alert.note: Alert for Guthrie; Polk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 06 at 4:13AM CDT until June 07 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall last evening continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Iowa and west central Iowa, including portions of Boone, Dallas, Polk and Guthrie counties. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is ongoing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 401 AM CDT, Law Enforcement stated that flooding is continuing across the area, where between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell. - While the Middle Raccoon River near Bayard is nearing a crest, the Beaver Creek near Woodward continues to rise, indicating significant runoff continues. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
